steps.text: In a medium mixing bowl, combine the Nilla Wafer crumbs and the melted butter
Line a square 8"x8" or 9"x9" baking pan with parchment paper, with extra paper sticking up from the edges
Press the mixture evenly into the bottom of the pan
Chill the crust in the refrigerator while performing next steps
In an electric mixer on medium speed, whip the heavy cream and sugar together until stiff peaks form, set aside (you can chill the bowl in the freezer for ~10 minutes to speed whipping)
In an electric mixer on medium speed, beat the cream cheese until smooth
Add the dry pudding mixes one at a time, beating well between each addition
Add the whipped cream and mix until smooth
Spread the cheesecake filling evenly over the chilled crust
Cover the pan with plastic wrap and refrigerate the cheesecake for 8 hours, or overnight
Cut chilled cheesecake into 16 squares (4x4) and serve with whipped cream and a banana slice
